isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - GENERAL INFORMATION - 1991 - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcproc.title: DATA LINK CONNECTOR
svcproc.para: The data link is a data communications system that transfers electronic information between various components on and off the vehicle.
On 9300 Series vehicles, the data link connector allows interfacing between on-board electronics and other electronic instruments.

The outline and pinout of the data link connector are shown in Figure 3. Two of the Data Link circuits are unique one labeled (+) and one (-). The signal on these wires is very different from standard truck-type electrical signals. Truck signals usually are on or off and either 12 volts DC or zero volts DC. The data link connector wires, (+) and (-), carry a pulsed signal which may or may not be detected with a voltmeter. Each chapter provides the specific connections and pin layout for that particular system.
An ohmmeter can be used to check wires in the engine control circuits, but specific diagnostic equipment must be used to check for proper system operation and diagnostics.
